snippet: An 82-year-old nun and two others will appear in court on Thursday after revealing a security lapse in one of the nation’s most important nuclear weapons facilities.
abstract: Sister Megan Gillespie Rice, 82-year-old nun, and fellow pacifists Michael R Walli and Gregory I Boertje-Obed, who broke in to the Oak Ridge nuclear weapons site in Tennessee, will appear in court to face charges of trespassing and spray-painting antiwar slogans; incident has also put the Energy Dept's security system on trial; private experts criticize agency's safeguarding of nuclear stockpiles.

byline.original: By MATTHEW L. WALD and WILLIAM J. BROAD

lead_paragraph: An 82-year-old nun and two others will appear in court on Thursday after revealing a security lapse in one of the nation’s most important nuclear weapons facilities.

headline.seo: Pacifists Who Broke Into Nuclear Complex Due in Court
headline.main: Security Questions Are Raised by Break-In at a Nuclear Site
headline.print_headline: Security Questions Are Raised By Break-In at a Nuclear Site
